Fields.DialogueText: What are you reading, Nagatsuki? Oh... looks, like a magazine... shopping?
Hai! It's a surfboard catalogue! I could really use a new board, but with the war... things have come to a halt.
I suppose it would. So you're just looking right now? Since you can't get one...
Oh, on the contrary, Kanchou. There are some that are still available. But with demand, there's a hefty price...
I see where this is going, so before you even start I'm just going to excuse myself and...
Oh, come on, Kanchou! You are very resourceful and I'm sure you can help me find a way to make my dream come true!

Fields.MenuText: Are you kidding me? No. I have other things to worry about right now.
You know you're putting me in a tough spot, right?
Uh-huh. I'll think about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Please, I don't ask for a lot... well, I've never asked for this!
What do I have to do to change your mind, Kanchou? Say it and I'll do it!
Ugh. Stop being so difficult, Kanchou! You can make it happen.
It doesn't work that way, Nagatsuki. You'll have to find a way to make it work on your own.
How am I going to do that?!
I don't know. Like you said, be resourceful. You'll find a way.
Hmph. Maybe they'll help me make my wishes come to life.
@BATTLE
Are you still pouting about that surfboard? Either way, what makes you think I would happen to know where to get that thing?
Hai. I'm pouting. My dreams are shattered and all you can do is tease me.
Ugh... What will I do with you, Nagatsuki...
After we deal with those Morganas, obviously.
Nagatsuki! What is this mess?! You can't just tear through it like a whirlwind!
Oh, it's just what I've been doing to figure out how to get that surfboard. I took your advice, Kanchou. I'm being resourceful!
Hah! Okay. So this is coming back around and biting me in the behind is what you're really saying.
Dōiu imi desuka? Aren't you proud? I took your advice.

Fields.MenuText: If making a mess was the advice I gave you, then it's absolutely my fault. But I'm pretty sure that wasn't the advice I gave, so...
I don't know if I want the credit f-f-for this... imagine what people would say!
I'm proud that you've taken initiative towards something you really want, but this mess is unacceptable.

Fields.DialogueText: No need for stress, Kanchou. A mess can always be picked up.
I'm beginning to think you're annoyed with me, Kanchou...
Hai, hai... I'll get this place all tided up.
*ALARM*
Ugh, enemies approaching. We're just going to have to work around this for now!
@BATTLE
We did rather well, even with my stuff lying about! Sō omowanai?
Right. Look, if we won a battle while a wolverine was chewing on my leg, I would not go on to say that having a wolverine chewing on my leg was a net positive.
What does that have to do with anything? We did well, despite the mess. Come on, you know it's true!
We did. That doesn't have anything to do with this... clean it up. It can be hazardous.
Worry wart. I'll clean it up.
Right now. I must get work done, so do it quietly.
Haaaai! But, while I do, I was hoping I could share some of my ideas with you about the surfboard...
I'm sorry, Nagatsuki, but it's not a good time. I have a lot on my plate... as do you. I don't know where you find the free time to do all that you do...
It's all in how you use it... I dance with time. Trying to outrun it will just leave you breathless, which in turn will put you further behind than when you started.
Interesting... We'll talk about your endeavors another day, Nagatsuki. Promise.
I'll hold you to it.
All hands to battlestations! Enemy inbound!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Frederic, what's our status?! Will someone tend to what is making the sirens go off?!
We're coming back around. Electrical systems took a hit there, Captain... The crew is taking care of the sirens - it'll take a few minutes.
I know. Is everyone all right?
I'll make rounds to be sure, Captain.
Very well, Frederic.
Nagatsuki, how are you holding up?
I'm... I'm okay, I think. That really shook us up.
Yes, just a little. We'll stabilize in a few.
Hai. I might have to take a seat after that one. ...Ah, who am I trying to fool! I need to do something.
It's okay to need to recollect yourself, Nagatsuki. We all need it from time to time.
I had all the sitting I needed, Kanchou. Listen - sirens are finally off. Those things are loud, aren't they?

Fields.MenuText: I thought you liked loud.
That's kind of the point.
You don't seem to be well, Nagatsuki. Perhaps you should lie down.

Fields.DialogueText: That hit must have thrown me off... the sirens just seem louder than usual.
Maybe I'm just being a bit sensitive. I'll... find a place to lay my head.
It was a hit, but I delivered the killer blows!
Do you need to go see the doc? Or the engineers?
Hai, hai. I'll be back in no time.
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
Watashi wa daijōbudesu yo. A little nap and I'll be fine.
Okay. Then go nap - that's an order.
All hands to battlestations! Enemy inbound!
@BATTLE
Captain, I don't mean to be alarmist here - but Nagatsuki is a destroyer, and not a new one. With some of the hits she's taken lately, I'm wondering how her superstructure is holding up.
I think you're underestimating us. But your point about her overall fitness...?
I'm not talking about a full refit or anything. But I am worried that we have vulnerabilities that are just waiting to be exposed by the next torpedo that comes along. If we...
Nonsense! The ship is fine - we'll be fine.
Oh, hi... Nagatsuki. I didn't see you there. I suppose you heard everything that has been said thus far?
Hai. I've been monitoring the maintenance crew and they're doing a splendid job. We'll be back in no time - and even better!
Noted. Frederic, check in with the crew and see if anybody has seen anything to support your concerns.
You don't believe me? That's rather rude... I'm the expert on this ship, Kanchou!
Umm... Okay, Captain. I'll be leaving now...

Fields.MenuText: You do realize I should write you up for that outburst, right?
Listen, members of the crew have to be able to report on the condition of the ship without worrying you'll jump in and start shouting.
You can't talk to me like that, Nagatsuki. It is undermining my authority... especially in front of a sailor.

Fields.DialogueText: Gomen'nasai. I didn't mean to do that... I just felt like I was being spoken of in a bad light.
Well, members of the crew should probably ask me how I'm feeling instead of guessing.
I was out of line, but for good reason.
Since you know a lot about this ship, why don't you fill me in with what is going on?
I did. We'll be back in shape once the maintenance crew finishes up. I have a date with the sea. Mata ne!
Okay, stop. Barging in angrily to shut down a conversation and then storming out when it's done isn't going to work.
I didn't barge in, Kanchou. You just didn't notice me standing there. I am a ship's Kami...
Umm... yes. Well, don't storm off in anger. It's not good... for us.
Hai, hai. Well, I'm not angry. I just want to catch this beautiful moon and ride these waves... they're not all the same, you know...
All right. I just wanted to know that... I'll see you then.
Hai.
I mean, if she weren't a Belle, I don't know that we'd even have survived the last couple of weeks.
That sure looks like a clean bill of health for the ol' superstructure, Kanchou. What did I tell you?
You and that smile... You were right, Nagatsuki, and I'm glad.
Hai. They're great - but I was still right. SO, have you been thinking about what I asked you?
By which you mean...
Fuzakeru na! The surfboard... I've been thinking of ways that I can get it and I'm coming up short.
I haven't given it thought, to be honest. I've been preoccupied with the war, the Morganas...
You're so talented at sucking all the joy out of life, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: I'm talented at warfare. Everything else is just a byproduct.
I mean, it is for the common good.
Sure. But it's the way it is - and that is that.

Fields.DialogueText: WHATEVER. Either way, you should learn how to look at things in a brighter way.
Sure, but can't you loosen up sometimes? Hmph...
It's rather rude to impose your dark attitude on us all. I can teach you a thing or two...
You have quite the impression of who you think I am, don't you? Assumption can get you in trouble, Nagatsuki.
Impressions are given, Kanchou. I'm only taking what you've offered me!
Huh.
I don't think wanting to surf is a waste of time. I mean, it helps me relate to the water in a different way, which is important - and I know you've given up on relaxation, but it's important.
Okay, but you have a perfectly sound board, don't you? Why don't you just sand and repaint your current board?
That's a wonderful idea! I can customize to my very liking! Oh, you may be drab, but you are a kanchou for a reason!
Drab? Really?
@BATTLE
I'll add that I'm also glad we have a crew diligent enough to investigate dangerous possibilities.
Are you actually angry with me? Usually it feels like you're teasing, but this...
I'm not angry. I just...
Go on.
Kanchou!
Is that a good "kanchou" or...
I really don't want you to get used to making a mess on the bridge, Nagatsuki... this is absolutely ridiculous.
Hehe... I'll clean it up, I promise. Guess what all of this is for?!

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I know what it's for...
You are such a pain, Nagatsuki...
I'm pretty sure I know. And I assume it's going to be spectacular.

Fields.DialogueText: There you go again with your wet blanket... cloaking it over the rest of us.
We all need a little mess in our lives... that's where inspiration is born, Kanchou!
Hai! You're learning!
We need to at least make room for everyone to get by, though. You can't just take over the bridge with your side projects!
Oh, but I did, Kanchou! So I can... you mean that I shouldn't.
I don't have time to scold you or play your games, Nagatsuki. Please, just organize this place.
Oh, I will. But if you were as attentive as I was, you would've noticed that I can't right now.
Oh, for... If we all die horribly because we can't move around the bridge, I'm going to spend my entire afterlife making you regret it!
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Sugoi! You've got some fire, don't you? I like it. I should rile you up more often.
Heh. You really are something else, Nagatsuki. You know exactly how far to push me and make me laugh.
Ditto, Kanchou. The difference is that I am funnier than you are... haha!
I resent that. I'm fun... I can be. You're just trying to distract me, Nagatsuki. Clean this stuff up.
It almost worked. Fine... but come with me, later. I want to show you the moon tonight.
Hmph... sure.
Fuuuuu... I got a workout today! The crew is looking good, though.
Are you talking about the fleet exercises earlier? I did catch a bit of it, and I agree. You all would impress the best of them.
Dōmo arigatō!
Is there a special occasion I'm missing?
Just open it - you're making me anxious!
If you insist. Wow, the wrapping is done beautifully... umm, a key?
It IS a key! Want to know what it goes to? GUESS!

Fields.MenuText: Can you help me narrow it down? Bigger than a breadbox?
Okay... does it go to something that locks?
If I always find ways to make something insipid, you always find ways to make things exasperating...

Fields.DialogueText: No hints! It's part of the build up to something WAHN-DERFUL!
Comes on, Kanchou. Please... I put a lot of thought into this.
What? You don't like surprises? ... Of course you don't. I sure hope my efforts to inject you with the fun bug will be rewarded...
Ugh, I might as well. You're not going to leave me alone, otherwise. Hmm... a key. Does it go to a room?
Īe... try again!
Hmph... a box?
HAI! Hmm... did someone tell you? How can you have guessed that so fast?
I don't know. Okay, so it goes to a box. Are you going to explain the rest to me? I do have things to do, Nagatsuki.
Hai, hai. I wouldn't overload you with fun... I'm not evil. The key goes to a box to a... pocket watch - here!
Wow. Is that mother of pearl?
I'm glad you like it, Kanchou. I saw it and it just said your name, so I couldn't pass it up.
Oh... um. I'm glad you thought of me, Nagatsuki. It will be used.
I didn't give it to you to just look at, haha!
@BATTLE
And, since you're being so nice, I have a treat for you... open it.
Hai!
Thank you, Nagatsuki. It's... spectacular.
Captain, we're receiving intel. Please stand by.
Hm. Nagatsuki, I need you to stay close, as well.
Aww... I was just heading off! I had a game planned with a few comrades.
Sorry. This might be important and I need you.
Oh... hai. I'm sure they'll understand.
I am done with decoding the telegraph. May I? Yes, well...
The long and the short of it is that we have an evacuation mission. We're expected at the given coordinates at 2300 hours.
Make the announcement, Frederic. Nagatsuki, I'm afraid you'll have to postpone your plans a bit longer. Let's get ready!
@BATTLE
Yatta! We did great, gals and lads!

Fields.MenuText: All right, all right. We did well, but we're still on the job.
You all did great out there. I want you all to know I couldn't be more proud of this crew.
Let's save the celebrations until after all the dust has settled.

Fields.DialogueText: Surviving the depths of our demise is worth celebration!
Kanchou... you do have a heart!
How can you be so stiff after such a win? It must be hard being you.
Yeah, yeah.
Come and have a drink with us. We would be honored to have you, Kanchou!
Sorry. I have a lot to do here, but thank you.
I wish you would come... just one drink? It doesn't even have to be alcoholic! The morale of the crew is just as important as our duties, and to see you there...
Okay, okay. One. And that is all. I'll meet you in a bit.
Yatta! Everyone will be excited, Kanchou. I'll save you a seat - see you there!
Okay, folks. If your shifts are over, get out of here and relax - with my compliments.
Wow, that looks great, Nagatsuki. It has a different look than the surfboard in the magazine.
Arigatō! I'm rather impressed myself! I decided I wanted the design to show the flow of the wind... the waves...
I can't wait to see it finished.
Oh. I know that, Kanchou. You don't owe anyone an explanation. I just like to tease!

Fields.MenuText: I wanted you to know... I've been coming off cold, it seems.
It's still something I should say more often.
You tease me, but I'm serious. I wanted you to know...

Fields.DialogueText: Okay. I know now... anything else?
Even though I feel it not necessary - thank you, Kanchou.
You're being ridiculous. You're creating stress from thin air!
Either way, thanks for listening. I'm proud of everyone here... we're still afloat and I couldn't do that on my lonesome.
Ha, ha... we know you are, Kanchou. You wear your wet blanket well, tee hee! There's no reason to dry it now.
Heh. How do you do that? Make everything fun or interesting... I admire that about you. You're peculiar to say the least, but you bring a light to everything you do.
If you carry the sun, it can't be dark for too long... I'm going out for that meeting with my comrades... the one that was postponed. Would you like to come?
I'll keep that in mind. Umm... sure. When is this meeting?
We'll have to leave now. I hope you're ready?
Hah - of course it's now. Yes, let me just do a few things and I'll be right behind you.
@BATTLE
So... I wanted to talk to you about something. In all the times we've butted heads, I hope I've never given you reason to think I doubt your abilities. Or your judgment.
Apart from the times when you clutter up the bridge.
All hands to battlestations! Enemy inbound!
@BATTLE
Frederic, please put the candles there... and the chrysanthemum vase here. I read all about this - it'll work.
Are you sure the Captain will be okay with this? I don't recall you asking...
Don't worry about it. If there's any problem, I'll take full responsibility. Kanchou needs this... I was basically ordered to do it!
I don't know... I'm a bit frightened at what our repercussions will be if this gets taken as an intrusion.
It's not like we're reading private papers, Frederic. We're just bringing some light to these quarters. There! We're done.
So it's too late to change our minds, I guess. I just hope the Captain's into fu...?
Fusui! It has to do with the arrangement of things to... listen, how much do you know about Onmyōdō?
Nagatsuki, Frederic... what are you doing in my - what the hell have you done to my quarters?!
Do you like it? I thought it was past time somebody harmonzied you and your environment!

Fields.MenuText: I'M NOT FEELING HARMONIZED!
It looks good, but you never asked me for permission. I have a problem with that.
Actually, this is really kind of amazing. I mean, next time, ask first, but...

Fields.DialogueText: It was my idea, Kanchou. I just dragged Frederic into it all.
Please don't look at Frederic in a bad light. He was just doing as I told him...
I knew you'd like it! And if you have to punish anybody for form's sake, let it be me. Frederic didn't know what he was helping me with until it was too late to escape.
I knew that, Nagatsuki. He doesn't have the audacity to do this on his own.
I'm not sure if that's a compliment or an insult, Captain. Am I to be reprimanded?
No, it's not an insult, Frederic. And, no, there will be no punishment... this time.
Yes, Captain. Thank you.
That was a nice gesture, Kanchou. It must be working!
Stop. I didn't discipline Frederic because the crew has standing orders to defer to you in matters concerning ship layout.
Ouch. That's rude - but I'm glad that Frederic didn't get in trouble because of me. Will I be punished?
No - but get out of here anyway. I'm pretty sure I've been awake for thirty-eight hours and I don't want to be awake anymore.
Light some of the candles, Kanchou - the scent should help loosen your kinks!
I just heard you say the word and I don't think I could even repeat--
You're dismissed.
Well, that's just sensible.
And also because I know you browbeat him until he was too confused to do anything but comply.
Go.
All right... mata ne!
Mmm... I slept exceptionally well last night. I did burn through half a candle - I forgot to blow it out. I was asleep in seconds...
You like it! I knew it would work... Frederic! Did you hear? It worked!
I did... but I'm not sure if the fusui is the credit. Is it, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I don't want to question it. I don't want to analyze it. I just want to stand here and feel good.
Actually, probably not. I got a new pillow the last time we were in port and took it out to use it last night.
Sure. Why not? It's a win for fusui.

Fields.DialogueText: Whatever you say, Kanchou! Anyway, we all know the truth.
Give it a week, Frederic. We - I mean, the fusui will get the credit it deserves!
Well, even if it's just coincidence, I am happy to see you shine today, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
Captain, I'm happy that you're rested - Morganas approaching.
Yep. Calculate their bearings, Frederic. Nagatsuki, I presume you're ready?
Hai! Ready for battle, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
You all right, Nagatsuki? The enemy seemed particularly motivated today...
Nonsense. We were just playing with them, Kanchou. There was never a moment when we weren't in control.
Okay, if that's the way you'd like to look at it...
Hmm, seems like the bridge needs to be considered for fusui. This is where you are most of your waking moments...
Thanks, but not now. I need you to go over fleet exercises. We're making gains in overall coordination, but there's still room to improve.
WAI - ugh...
Maybe dial the sarcasm down a notch or two.
Hai, hai. Then we'll get the bridge sorted. Mata ne!
Haaaiii. We love fleet exercises... it's one of our favorite pastimes!
You're up to your craziness early, Nagatsuki.
Watashi wa kurutte imasen! I'm just bringing in things that I'll need to work some fusui on the bridge! I have things planned, so it won't take long.
How long is "not long?" This isn't the most cluttered the bridge has ever been, but I still don't want to see it every time I'm on duty.
Oh, I don't know. A few days? I won't be rearranging things today.
Actually, yes, I think you will do it today. All this clutter is a safety hazard.
And, hey, I'm glad you like the fusui so much that you're practically begging me to get it done here on the bridge!

Fields.MenuText: Don't push your luck, Nagatsuki.
It's not so much "practically begging" as "explicitly ordering you to get it over with."
You know me. I like to keep my dragon lines unobstructed.

Fields.DialogueText: Wow, you really need it done in here. Kanchou, breathe in... breathe out...
You're obviously in a bad mood, but you don't need to be so mean...
Listen to you! There's hope for you yet, Kanchou!
I don't know what to do with you sometimes, Nagatsuki...
I have a date with a friend for edomae-zushi, so I'll do it when I get back. Would you like me to bring some food for you?
You know what? I'll take you up on that. Thank you.
Good. I'll be back, and I'll take care of this then.
Very well.
Oh, I wouldn't let it endanger anyone, Kanchou. But, fine, I'll get started in a few minutes.
Would this be a good time to talk about realigning the conning tower?
Kanchou? Oh, there you are... I brought back edomae-zushi... I had tea with my friend and decided to have my food with you!
That would be nice. We need to talk anyway.
Hai. We need to talk about how you've been all over the place. Up, down... that can't be good for your health!

Fields.MenuText: One could make the case that you're the cause of a good seventy-five percent of those ups and downs, you know.
It probably isn't. But you don't take a command position in a war expecting life to treat you gently.
Dammit, this isn't about me.

Fields.DialogueText: You say that, but the whole crew lives with me, and you're the only one that seems to be in horrible moods all the time.
I have no idea what you are talking about right now, Kanchou.
Whoa, you are over the top right now! Are you okay?
I'm sorry. I'm not at my best. But, Nagatsuki, I need to be able to move around the bridge without worrying I'll trip over a... I don't even know what that is.
I told you that I'd be back to clean it all up - and here I am! I'll take care of it once we're done eating. How is the sushi?
It's good... fresh. Look, I need you to hear what I'm saying. I can't work in these conditions.
Hmm... I see. I won't do it again, Kanchou. I'm sorry for causing you distress. It wasn't my intention.
I know. Believe me, I know. And I'm conscious of the fact that you're doing it for my benefit as much as anything else. But I do worry about the bridge crew.
Hai, hai. I understand, Kanchou. But you don't mind if I finish the project, do you? As long as I do it quickly?
Not at all. I have looked over the plans, and I don't see anything that would clash with Neutrality Fleet regs. And I think it'll look good. Just... get it done quickly.
Hai! I'm glad we had this talk.
Me too, Nagatsuki...
@BATTLE
I love it in here, Nagatsuki. It seems everyone else does, too.
Of course they do... you've been in high spirits! The spaces that you're in the most have been changed and you're showing that it all works.
Hmm... I suppose you're right. You know, I saw something today. I think you'd be happy to know about...
Should I guess?! Did you get me something?
No, there's no guess and I didn't get you anything, Nagatsuki. The surfboard you had your eye on... it's on sale. Look, here...
Sōdesu ne...

Fields.MenuText: Is it that much of a disappointment?
You can do whatever you put your mind to, Nagatsuki. Don't be lazy.
I'm sorry. I seem to have struck a nerve, Nagatsuki... I didn't mean to cause you distress.

Fields.DialogueText: It's just that I moved on from it and started the project with my old board because I knew I wouldn't be able to save for that one. To be taunted with it now...
You sure do know how to take someone's dreams and crush them like it meant nothing.
Oh, well. That's life - isn't that what they say?
Oh... I don't know what to say, Nagatsuki. I brought it up because I thought you'd be happy to know that it was on sale...
I can't afford it, so I don't wish to hear about it anymore. By the way, I'm finished updating my old board... I was going to show you.
You can still show me! I'd love to see it... Oh, it'll have to wait. I'm sorry, Nagatsuki... Funayūrei ahead!
@BATTLE
Well, I'm headed out. Mata ne.
Mind if I come along?
Why? To make fun of my board? I just want to be alone with the waves for a while.
Could you be alone with the waves and me? You're my friend, Nagatsuki... and I kind of think you could use the company.
I'm your friend? Umm... Hai. You should put on a coat, though. It's cold out.
I will. And I'm sorry about the board, Nagatsuki.
Hai...
I don't have that much money, though. And I wouldn't be able to save before the sale expires. Thanks for thinking of me though, Kanchou.
Nagatsuki... when you have a minute, can we talk?
Mmhm. I'm just calculating our bearings for Frederic. All right...
I have tea set up in my quarters. Do you mind?
Umm... hai. Okay. I planned to practice Itago in half an hour, though - will it take long?
Not at all. Come on... you can ask questions on our way there.
Hai. What is this about? I know that I was a bit upset about the board, but I'm over it...
Yes... it's not about that. Let's sit and have tea. Go ahead, get comfortable, Nagatsuki.
How can I, when this is something out of the ordinary? Will you just get on with it? I love surprises, but I'm just not in the mood today, Kanchou.
Here... open it. I got this for you. I haven't been able to get a hold of that surfboard, but I hope this is a reasonable consolation prize.
Film reels?
You sure I wouldn't be a bother? As far as I'm concerned, you're under no obligation to...
I am asking you because I'd love for you to join me, Kanchou. So, what will it be?
Can I bring popcorn?
Hai! I think you absolutely should!
@BATTLE
Recordings of sumo matches. Everything I could get my hands on. I know you can't be there in person for them, but...
*sniff*
You're a really good friend, Kanchou. A really, really good friend.

Fields.MenuText: You're welcome.
Hang on. I have a clean handkerchief here somewhere.
... Did I screw this up somehow?

Fields.DialogueText: Baka.
That... may be excessive. But I do try.
You want to watch them with me?
Hell, that's a torpedo wake!
Right! Calculating, Captain. Here...
Preparing torpedoes, Kanchou. READY?!
Tatakai!
@BATTLE
We're not dead yet, Kanchou. Our maintenance crews have the latest damage well in hand.
Right. Frederic, are we on track or have we drifted off course?
We've gone a bit west... but it's not a worry. We'll back on track in two to three hours.
Wonderful. You've all done well, despite the circumstances.
We prepare for this every day, Kanchou. Now, have you considered what you'll be wearing for our sumo night?

Fields.MenuText: It would be silly for me to expect you not to ask me something like this at the moment...
Nagatsuki, we're watching film reels, not spending a night on the town. Is it really that big a deal?
Yes! It's all pressed and ready to go... How about you worry about things that are important, Nagatsuki?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, to me... us... battle is our every day. So anything that takes our mind off of it is worth exercising.
Oh, just have some fun with it.
I want you to make an effort! I would be ashamed if you were to show up unkempt.
Okay, I promise I will be as well-groomed as our circumstances allow.
I don't know, Kanchou. What you wear to sumo night reflects on me as your ship. I want to see what you're wearing and be sure it's up to standards.
All right. I know of no woman who is as forward and energetic as you are, Nagatsuki. Here... does this pass?
Oh... sure. It's your kanchou suit...
Uniform. The word is "uniform." And I think it's rather dignified.
Hai. That'll do. Now just don't be late when the show's meant to start.
Oh, psh. I've been credibly accused of a lot of faults, but I'm always punctual when it counts.
Mmhmm. We will see!
Frederic, we're under attack! Where are... there they are.
All hands to battlestations! Enemy inbound!
@BATTLE
Are you still adding to your surfboard, Nagatsuki? The cherry blossom tree seems to be growing...
Haha! Hai! I've added branches and flowers, and whenever it's dry, I add more - I have leftover paint!
It's beautifully done, Nagatsuki...
Arigatō! I saw the design in a magazine. I love the life of a cherry blossom and thought it fitting.
Interesting... sounds like there's a story behind it?
Hai. Would you like to hear it?
Do I sense some ambivalence there? Is this something you're rather keep private?
Well, I'll share it with you... but I'd like you to keep it to yourself. If you're comfortable with that.
Oh, come on, Nagatsuki. I'm the captain of this ship... there are many things I know that I don't share.
I never thought of that, Kanchou. Umm... okay.
Or, again, we can change the subject.
No, Kanchou, this is good. The cherry blossoms on my board represent the cycle of life. In spring they come and share their beauty with all and wither away in fall to make room for the next.
In a sense, the waves you ride are the same, right? Rising and falling, unique but always reborn. Pardon me for waxing poetic.
But you're right! I love those natural patterns. The waxing and waning of the moon is another. I would love to just dance under the moon for the rest of my life...
But you can't?
I need the sun to remind me of how important the moon is... without it, I would forget. You can only miss something when it is truly gone.
Hah. For the record, I don't think I know anyone with a heart as big as yours.
Thank you for listening, Kanchou... that makes you beautiful.
Kanchou, I brought this for you... it's for sumo night.
A bow tie? Why?
What do you mean why? You'll wear this with your kanchou suit.

Fields.MenuText: Okay... very well. It would go well with it, I suppose.
No. I don't need help dressing myself, Nagatsuki! Why do you feel the need to give me this?!
"Uniform." The word is "uniform."

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have to wear it. I just want you to consider it, Kanchou.
Demo... I picked it out and thought of you...
Either way... it was just for you to have a choice.
So, I take it the plan for the films is to invite the crew, but to encourage... well, bow ties? Semi-formal wear?
Hai. "Encourage" is the word, of course. Not "order." I won't throw anyone out for dressing casually - not even you.
*ALARM*
Right. We have company. The unwanted variety, as usual... ready?
Hai, hai. Always, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
You know, I think you should consider wearing the bow tie during battle.
No.
It would show the crew you're proud of your appearance.
We're not having this conversation.
Oh, and I could get you a flower for your lapel!
Please stop.
But this is special to me, and I want it to feel special to... oh, no.
Frederic, you've heard about the sumo films, right?
Yeah. Listen, I apologize for my frankness, but you've been talking about them ever since you got them.
You've put up posters, for heaven's sake.
Hmph... well, I'm excited! I love SUMO!
Sure. Fat men in diapers slapping each other is...
Frederic, don't. She's happy. We're happy. You be happy too.
Well, I had to, didn't I? You were the one who got the films. It would've been terribly rude not to involve you.

Fields.MenuText: I mean, if you'd rather. You still have time to invite someone other me.
Nope. You're stuck with me.
Wait, really? I can get out of this just by complaining more?

Fields.DialogueText: Joking! I'm joking!
Oh, but you're a delight. And in the bow tie? Kawaii!
No!
Ah, well. It'll be fun.
What about you, Frederic? Will we see you at the show?
I'm afraid I'm going to be on duty, ma'am.
Kanchou's the only grump we need on this bridge, Frederic. Be nice!
@BATTLE
Listen to Kanchou. Kanchou is wise.
You know, people don't say that often enough.
And you'll be going to the big show too, Captain?
Hai. As my escort!
She got me a bow tie and everything.
Though if you keep complaining about the bow tie, I can find someone else.
We haven't actually formally set a start time yet.
I'm prepared to be flexible in my working hours, Captain.
Heh.
Prepare for battle! Coming in from the SOUTH!
@BATTLE
Sugoi! I think our constant surfboard outings and fleet exercises have really upped our abilities!
If that's your way of saying these guys would have killed us at the start of the war, I agree. They're getting stronger - and we can't relax.
I made you a lucky charm for the sumo match... it's to be stitched onto your bow tie!

Fields.MenuText: Umm... no.
So, what, the bow tie would have a patch on one side?  Asymmetry? That's kind of a fun idea, actually.
Hmm... I don't know, Nagatsuki. I think the simplicity of the tie and the knot is a statement in itself.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't be silly, Kanchou! People will see you from a mile away and say “oh, how wonderful!”
I thought you'd like it!
Like anything else I've given you, it's your choice!
I'm not actually sure why I need a good luck charm, though. Even if I root for some particular wrestler, some of these matches are months old.
Well, if you already know the winners, you'll need good luck finding someone to bet against you.
Heh.
I think you could stand to relax just a little bit.
You mean a lot.
Hai. I mean a lot.
Oh! I have a present for you!
Hello, you. How's the day treating you?
Ohh... it's been lovely. I went for a swim - and then the crew and I breezed through fleet exercises!

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, sure. Let me wrap things up here.
Sorry. I have things to take care of, Nagatsuki. Another time?
Maybe. How toxic does the food seem to be today?

Fields.DialogueText: Good! You need to be well-fed and fit, Kanchou - because tonight is the night for sumo!
Hai, hai. But you will be around tonight for the sumo viewings, right?
It won't kill you before tonight's big sumo show, Kanchou. I'll have medics standing by to be sure!
Ah. We finally found a working projector and a window in our collective schedules?
Hai and hai!
That's fantastic! Now I just hope the movies are what they're supposed to be.
Nanda?
I mean, I was given reels of film in canisters. I assume they're what they say they are, but...
Kanchou. This. Isn't. Funny.
@BATTLE
Would you like to hear about it over lunch? My treat!
I mean, since it's free.
I got that.
It's a little bit funny.
Please tell me you didn't reschedule the sumo viewing to check that the films were legitimate. I really do trust the people who got them for us.
Oh, it wasn't that, Kanchou. Too many of the crew were working after that last battle, and ...OH! Look, a butterfly!
What on earth is it doing all the way out here?
Matte... do you see that? That speck out there?
Let me take a look... Ahh... we have company, Nagatsuki.
Hai. And our butterfly friend came up to warn us!
@BATTLE
Well fought, Nagatsuki. Again.
Oh, I've been trying to raise a colony of them down in the hold.
You... wait, what? How? What do they eat?
Anata totemo yasashīdesu. You were pretty good yourself.
So. Do we really have a horde of butterflies down below?
Not a horde. A few. I don't know how they got on board in the first place, but I've been trying to keep them warm and safe. For as long as they're with us, I want them to be happy.

Fields.MenuText: You're a very positive person. You're almost aggressively positive.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō gozaimasu!

Fields.MenuText: As long as you keep it all off the bridge.

Fields.DialogueText: ... You're a great kanchou, but you're still a grump.
And proud of it!

Fields.MenuText: I may regret saying this, but... let me know if I can help.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! You know I will!
So, Kanchou... what are you up to now? Your shift is over, right?
... I guess I'm going to go check the sumo films. I mean, I'm sure they're what they're supposed to be, but...
You can never be too sure.
Exactly.
Good for you for not just ordering Frederic to do it.
Yeah, well. If I turns out I got a bunch of old newsreels I'd rather the embarrassment be contained at the source.
You're sure you don't want to watch the sumo films, Frederic?
You checked them out?
I squinted at several frames from each. If they're anything other than sumo, whatever it is has a remarkable number of very large men.
Well, I'm content to hear about them after the fact, Captain.
Anyway - Kanchou, are you ready for sumo night? What do you think of my getup?
You're looking remarkably spiffy for a lady on her way to a mess hall.
And you're not too shabby yourself. But where's the bow tie with the patch?

Fields.MenuText: In my pocket. It goes on the second I'm officially off duty.
Sorry. It just doesn't go with the uniform.
I dunno. Must've fallen into the ocean. Very sad.

Fields.DialogueText: Just you wait. It'll look fantastic.
I think you mean "kanchou suit."
Not. Funny.
So. Is it time already? Shifts are over, the projector's up, and all the rest?
Hai! The show is about to begin! Frederic, don't let the place burn down while we're busy!
What? Of course not!
Don't listen to her, Frederic! Let's go, Nagatsuki.
Oh, Frederic! We've finally gotten Kanchou to lighten up, and now *you're* becoming a killjoy!

Fields.MenuText: I am not "lightening up."
It's true, Frederic. You cloud of gloom, you.
Heh.

Fields.DialogueText: *sigh* Apparently not.
Oh, well. Improving your outlook on life can be my next project!
... Or not. Is "not" an option?
Heh.
You say "mess hall," I say "special cinematic venue!"
*sigh*
Kanchou! Enemy incoming!
We need to finish them off quickly if tonight's going to go ahead as planned!
I generally prefer to finish them off quickly even when we *don't* have sumo films to watch...
@BATTLE
We have enemies coming in...
Ha ha! Why would they think they'd get away with that?! Stupid Funayūrei.
Save the gloating until they're sunk. Much more satisfying that way.
Nothing wrong with spreading the satisfaction around, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Are you off somewhere without even pausing to gloat, Nagatsuki?
Gomen! I was going to take care of some little problems with the boilers before fleet exercises.
Right. Then don't let me get in your way.
Oh, you're never in the way, Kanchou.
If only because you can walk through walls.
I'm serious! And I still haven't found a way to thank you properly for the sumo films - that was so much fun!

Fields.MenuText: Thank me by fixing those boilers before they give out.
Stop. It was fun for everybody - and that's what friends are for, anyway.
I hope this means I'm forgiven for the surfboard incident.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, hai!
Hai. And that's why I'm going to find something you enjoy. Mark my words, Kanchou!
I don't even remember what you're talking about. I love my current board!
Hey, Kanchou - after the boilers and the fleet exercises, do you want to go for a walk with me? It's a nice day, and I was thinking of letting the butterflies out for some exercise.
Letting the... sure. That sounds great.
Mata ne!
Kanchou, this storm is rough! the sirens are going to go off... Now.
*ALARM*
I salute your timing, anyway. What's going on? Are we under attack, or is it just another wiring problem?
We're taking on quite a bit of water, but I think that's it, Captain.
Hai! The rain's just really coming down! I love it... I want to surf in this! Did you see the waves?!

Fields.MenuText: We're taking on water and you're concerned with the waves you're going to ride?
You love this?! You do realize we're on the verge of capsizing, right? But you love this...
I know! It's exciting, right?

Fields.DialogueText: If we don't make it through this what makes us think we'll make it through another battle?!
The storm and the rain are not problems for us! Get your buckets out!
Hai! It reminds you you're alive!
*ALARM*
Nagatsuki is right... it's really not that bad. The siren should go off... now.
Oh, okay-
But we have Funayūrei approaching! It looks like the storm brought them in!
To say nothing of the sirens. Whatever - let's give them an enthusiastic welcome!
@BATTLE
The weather was a bigger deal than the Funayūrei... I'm going to head out now. I want to get a piece of this before it's gone.
Ride a big wave for me. I'll see you later... Oh, and be careful out there!
*ALARM*
... Of course you are.
Either way, we have sirens going off. We need to take care of that... how are we doing, Frederic?
